db:abstract.db:para: This material uses an effect with a single render pass approach and performs per fragment lighting. Techniques are provided for OpenGL 3 and OpenGL ES 3.

db:section.db:title: ambientOcclusion : Texture
db:section.db:para: Holds the current ambient occlusion map texture of the material. This can only be a texture, otherwise it is ignored. By default this map is not set.

db:section.db:title: baseColor : variant
db:section.db:para: Holds the current base color of the material. This can be either a plain color value or a texture. By default the value of this property is "grey".

db:section.db:title: metalness : variant
db:section.db:para: Holds the current metalness level of the material, as a value between 0 (purely dielectric, the default) and 1 (purely metallic). This can be either a plain uniform value or a texture. By default the value of this property is 0.

db:section.db:title: normal : Texture
db:section.db:para: Holds the current normal map texture of the material. This can only be a texture, otherwise it is ignored. By default this map is not set.

db:section.db:title: roughness : variant
db:section.db:para: Holds the current roughness level of the material. This can be either a plain uniform value or a texture. By default the value of this property is 0.

db:section.db:title: textureScale : real
db:section.db:para: Holds the current texture scale. It is applied as a multiplier to texture coordinates at render time. Defaults to 1.0.
When used in conjunction with WrapMode.Repeat, textureScale provides a simple way to tile a texture across a surface. For example, a texture scale of 4.0 would result in 16 (4x4) tiles.
